title: GitHub Copilot Free Plan Launch
description: GitHub introduced a free tier for Copilot in VS Code with 2000 monthly code completions and unlimited code suggestions, making AI-powered coding accessible to all developers.

community_feedback.quote: Is the new GitHub Copilot free tier good enough? The 2000 monthly completions limit seems reasonable for casual users.
Great news for developers as GitHub announces a new free tier of Copilot upon reaching 150m users

title: Enhanced AI Model Support with 64k Context Window
description: Copilot Chat now supports a 64k token context window with OpenAI GPT-4o, enabling better handling of large codebases and complex queries.

community_feedback.quote: The 64k context window is a game-changer for working with large codebases - can finally maintain context across entire projects.

title: Repository Knowledge Generation
description: Devin now automatically scans repositories and generates Repo Knowledge to enable faster and more successful task completion through better codebase understanding.

community_feedback.quote: We are not even close to the point where AI can 'replace' a software engineer, but tools like Devin are getting better at specific tasks.
$100/hour in AI API token fees seems excessive for what you get compared to traditional tools.

title: Engineering Team Integration and Enhanced Capabilities
description: All engineering teams can now tag Devin for tasks including frontend bug fixes, first-draft PRs for backlog items, and code refactoring with improved workflow integration.

title: Aider v0.86.0 with Expanded Model Support
description: Added support for all GPT-5 models across providers and Grok-4 integration, while maintaining the project's trend of AI self-development with 88% of code written by AI.

community_feedback.quote: GPT-5-high is the best coding model period, scoring 88% on the Aider Polyglot benchmark.
The cost is impressive at around $29 for evaluation, and the benchmark results are truly groundbreaking.

title: Enhanced Context Awareness and Mission Control
description: Improved ability to see recent changes via Git, access copy buffer, and larger range of relevant code definitions. Updated Mission Control interface for easier workflow creation and tool integration.

community_feedback.quote: I can recommend Continue.dev since it allows you to use any llm backend and you get to control all the params and context.
Continue.dev is the Swiss Army Knife of AI coding tools - sometimes it struggles with complex tasks but the flexibility is unmatched.
